intro: Thysanotus patersonii subsp. manglesianus, commonly known as the Mangles' bluebell, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia, particularly Queensland. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
